summary: Closure does not handle getters/setters correctly

comments.content:
Getters are not currently supported as they are not part of EmcaScript 3, but as they
are part of EcmaScript 5 it is something will need to be supported.  

You should at least get a parser error.  I'm curious what the Rhino AST looks like
for this.

Yes, a parser error would be preferable to silently converting them to functions. But 
it would be even better if there was proper support for them. After all, they are 
supported by all "good" browsers.
